title: Font recommendation: slightly rounded condensed sans?
content:
Hi. I’m looking for a condensed sans serif that comes in a decent set of weights including a light. I want something that has the formal structure of, say, Akzidenz or Univers but with slightly rounded edges. I don’t mean something explicitly rounded, just a softer more ‘modern’ edge.

Village’s [Section](http://web.archive.org/web/20060719212905/http:/www.vllg.com/Lux/Section/mudTyper+Weights/) is quite good but more condensed would be nice…

Any tips greatly appreciated.
author: aaronseymour

comments.content: Another Process face: [Bryant](http://web.archive.org/web/20060719212905/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Bryant) has soft edges and condensed styles.
[Sophisto](http://web.archive.org/web/20060719212905/http:/stewf.com/work/hattenbach/soph1.html) is modern too, but it’s not very soft.
And there’s the recently popular [Neo Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20060719212905/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=C.117386.0.0), but it’s no more condensed than Section.
